column1: length ball angling across him, cut to point. the fielder has a shy and hits the stumps, and they take a single off the ricochet
on the pads and worked away for a single
loud shout for lbw, but that pitched outside leg and struck him on the pads
angled across him, on a length and ends up on off, pushed to cover
fuller length, keeps it tight on off stump, and Kamran doesn't have the room to free his arms, can just push it into the off side

play and a miss! Keeps to that tight line but pulls his length back a tad, and the extra bounce has Kamran feeling for the ball. He's fortunate that didn't take the edge, was close to his bat on off stump
back of a length on the pads, and flicked to deep square leg. Tanvir, who has just completed an over, was running around to field, so they steal a second

there's the pace Hasnain has become famous for. Back of a length on off, Imam was running down the track and giving himself room. Wanted to crash it through cover but done in by the pace and bounce, doesn't connect

got him! no opening partnership heroics today. The pacy Hasnain gets it to bounce a fair bit from a hard length. Imam was coming down the track again, despite failing to do it successfully last ball, and he gets a top edge from his attempted swipe that swirls in the air before settling into mid-off's hands
back of a length outside off and shaping away from the batsman, he lets it go through

they've opted to review an lbw call The batsman was moving across the stumps to flick and Hasnain got it to move in off a length and pinged him on the knee roll. However, DRS shows that it was bouncing just over the stumps. Looked very close in real time, which prompted the review.
crashed Kamran shows his good form. This was a little too short and wide, gave him the room to free his arms and he absolutely flayed it through the off side for a boundary
steered to third man
nice tight line, stump to stump and on a length, and all Kamran can do is tap it into the offside
strays on the pads that time, which allows Kamran to move across and flick it to deep midwicket
strays on the pads again, and Kamran wants to tickle it fine but doesn't get enough on it. Just a single to short fine leg
elegant takes a short step forward and opens the face of the bat to drive through cover for a boundary
fullish on off, pushed to mid-off
welcomed with a massive hit that was in the slot, Kamran got down on one knee, and picked it up from outside off to slog sweep powerfully , way into the midwicket stands
another slog-sweep, but only got the bottom half of the bat on that one. Still hit so hard that it found the boundary at deep midwicket
changes his line by firing it into the leg stump. Kamran was going for another slog sweep but it was too close tohis body and he misses it
backs away and cuts this length ball to point from the stumps
smashed gives himself room again, ends up well outside off. This was full outside off and he crashes it through the offside for a crackling boundary

the bowler has the last laugh Backing away had worked for Kamran but he chose to shimmy down the track for this one. Nawaz shortened his length, got it to pitch on leg and turn away past the swinging bat to rattle the stumps. Kamran has thrown it away here, he was looking supremely dominant. Nawaz is pumped, as is Sarfaraz behind the stumps
starts off with a slower ball, but Maqsood has read it. Too full and he just leans into his push. Such great timing on that, it beats extra cover comfortably and races to the fence
keeps to a full length but on leg stump that time, driven to long-on
through Umar Akmal's legs at cover a single turns into a double. That was a well disguised slower one, and dipped suddenly on the batsman. He managed to push it away, but Umar made a mess of that
fuller on off, driven fluently but straight to cover
back of a length and on the off stump line, steered to point
length ball on off, punched to cover

dropped by Ahmed Shehzad running back at extra cover What a fairytale start it would have been for Fawad! Googly first up, draws him into a drive, and the leading edge flies up. Shehzad seemed to have it covered, Bravo was hovering nearby, but he couldn't hold on
length ball on the stumps, pushed to long-on
big appeal but not given googly pitched outside leg, he went for a sweep and was struck on the pads. May have pitched outside leg
another googly turning in from leg stump and hits the pads. Half appeal but that had pitched outside and Fawad knows it
googly again, but slightly short, pulled to mid-on
given some air, on a length on middle stump and turning away, pushed to point. Needless shy at the stumps, no one backing up, so they get a run

beaten and loud appeal! but he was struck just outside the line. He's getting it to dip nicely, and the batsman was drawn into coming forward. Went for the drive but was beaten, with the ball spinning into him and rapping pad. Rolls away to short third man
length ball on off, pushed between point and cover
fullish on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
a little shorter, spinning into off stump, he gets behind it and punches to long-on
fuller, dipping into him again, pitches on middle and turns, he tries to work it away but only inside edges on to pad and the ball doesn't travel much
googly, pushed into the offside
nicely tossed up, he was coming down the track but it dips on his toes, and he can only push it into the offside. Another googly
sneaks through that was the leg break, pitched on off and spun away, he wanted to cut it but doesn't connect
worked from off stump to deep midwicket
shot another googly tossed up but he seemed to have read it, and came down the track to smash it back over the bowler's head. First authoritative stroke off Fawad
another googly, this one turns sharply, he moves back and swipes across the line to midwicket
given some air outside off, he takes a stride out with bat close to pad and steers it to point's left
angled into him, quicker one. Defended off the front foot
shorter and even quicker, that came on to him too quickly. He wanted to pull it into the stands, but gets the high part of the bat and the ball drops near him on the off side
pushed to cover for a single
too short and hammered that sat up and asked to be hit, and he pulled it from outside off to the midwicket boundary
better length, spinning back into him from outside off and he can only flick it to short midwicket
through him was he waiting for the slower ball? That one cut back in sharply from outside off and Maqsood is very late on it, goes between bat and body to the keeper

peachy a little shorter and a little wider outside off, and Maqsood cuts it delicately but with superb timing to send it racing to the third man fence. He played it square and the third man fielder who was fine runs but can't cut it off

caught at long-off This is clever bowling by Bravo, one of the foremost experts in this format. He bowled at normal pace the first two balls and even conceded a boundary. This one is the slower one that dips on the batsman, and Maqsood is too early into his lofted drive. Ends up toe-ending it and is caught comfortably by long-off running to his left
And now he bowls a short one that snorts up at the batsman's throat
back of a length on off and Amin opens the face of the bat while driving to find the third man fence. Fawad Ahmed is the fielder, but he's not going to risk the broken jaw diving, so it's a four
slower ball again, pushed into the offside and they take a quick single, but the fielder at mid-off runs in and effects a direct hit. They go upstairs, but the batsman had made it home in time
pushed to cover
length ball on off, punches it off the back foot to the bowler's left
clobbered Nawaz went marginally short but he spotted it early, rocked back and used his power to muscle this over deep midwicket, pulling it from knee height
fuller on off, and he comes across to work it to deep midwicket
tossed up, but too full, driven to long-off
back of a length quicker one on off stump, he goes on the back foot to punch but straight to midwicket
full on middle and angling in. Defended off the front foot
tossed up just outside off, and he drills this googly past the bowler's left. Protection at long on though
full on middle, and clipped away to midwicket off the front foot. They walk across for a single
full on middle, and straightening after hitting the deck. Defended with the bat's open face to point
lofted! Full on middle, but he takes a big stride forward, before hammering a slog over long on
length ball, just outside off, and turning further away. Cut square to deep point for one
low full toss on middle, and he nearly taps this straight to Bravo. Goes just past his left to long on
slower ball, on a length outside off stump. Guided with gentle hands to point for a single
length ball on middle, and fended off the back foot
low full toss on off, and driven to long on for a single
back of a length on middle, and angling inwards. Nudged off his hips to square leg for a single
full on middle, and the outswinger is driven to Shahzad at cover. Has a shy at the bowler's end, but misses

back of a length on middle, and he swivels to pull. Struck well but straight to Tanvir at deep midwicket! The man was there for that shot, and Amin finds the only outfielder on the leg side. Hasnain, you beauty!
full toss on off, and he mistimes a drive to long on for a single
snorter! Back of a length, just outside off, and the ball gets big on Nabi. Does well to sway away from this delivery
slower ball, back of a length outside off, and punched off the back foot to deep point
length ball, on middle, and he swings across the line. Mistimed to long on on this occasion
back of a length on off, and firmly defended off the front foot
length ball, just outside off, and cut away with the turn to deep point
length ball on middle, and turning away from the batsman. He looks to defend, and the ball takes an outside edge towards the off side
full on middle, and driven down the ground to mid-on
full just outside off, and he goes down on one knee to slog across the line. Slices it, and Shahzad at deep midwicket makes no mistake
length ball on off, and he prods forward to block off the front foot
full on middle, and the googly skids through. He takes a huge stride forward to block. 1-22 for Fawad
flicked fine! Length ball on leg, and he tries to nudge this fine. Ball grazes his thigh-guard instead, and that's Peshawar's 100
length ball on middle, and worked away to midwicket
full, angling away from Sammy, and he clatters a square cut to deep extra cover
back of a length outside leg, and he makes room to play the pull. Ball goes under his bat, and through to the keeper. Soft appeal for lbw from the keeper, but the ball did not come off his bat
length ball outside leg, and he tries to nudge towards square leg. Ball hits his knee-roll and dribbles away to point
full on middle, and the slower ball is mistimed to the leg side. Sammy was winding up for the big shot, but adjusts due to the lack of pace
back of a length on leg, and he mistimes a leg-side swipe to deep backward square
back of a hand slower ball, wide outside off, and Pollard backs away before trying to cut. Can't connect, and the umpire says 'not a wide'
back of a length ball on off, and he drags a pull away to deep midwicket
full on off, and he clears his front leg to slog over midwicket. Sliced over point instead
slower ball, length delivery outside off. And Pollard flat-bats a slapped shot between cover and mid off!
edged to the keeper! That's Hasnain's third. Short on off, and Pollard can't resist the pull. Tries to play this across the line, and that's taken a feather-edge to the keeper
length ball on middle, and he drags a leg-side swipe to deep midwicket
yorker on off, and he mistimes a shot to mid off
dropped at long on! And that's Umar Akmal. Full toss just outside off, and he lifts this down the ground. Straight down Akmal's throat, but the ball pops out
back of a length, just outside off and angling away. Left alone by Sammy, but the umpire thinks that was too high
low full toss, wide outside leg, and Sarfaraz does well to stop the ball from going past him
back of a length on middle, and pulled to deep midwicket
drilled! Full and wide, and Wahab absolutely clatters a cover drive through to the extra cover boundary. Man at the ropes tries to use his feet to stop the ball, but the pace was just too much
low full toss on middle, and he sweeps to deep midwicket
low full toss on middle, and swiped to Bravo at deep midwicket
back of a length, just outside off, and he shuffles across the stumps to paddle. Mistimes to square leg
back of a length on off, and he tries to pull. Top-edged to fine leg
back of a length just outside off, and he mistimes a pull to deep midwicket
low full toss on off, and he mistimes to long on
back of a length, just outside off, and ramped over short third man for four!
back of a length, wide outside off, and he pulls along the ground to long on
full and wide outside off, and the attempted cover drive takes an inside edge to deep midwicket
low full toss on off, and he mistimes a drive to long on
length ball on off, and he pulls along the ground to deep midwicket
full toss, very wide outside off, and he flat-bats a shot down to long on. But sharp fielding in the deep, and the throw from the deep sends Wahab packing
full toss, wide outside off, and he flat-bats a shot down to long on! Peshawar finish on 138
short and wide, and cut square to point. Slight misfield, but he recovers well
angling into his pads, and worked away to the vacant square-leg region for a single
angling in again, and clipped to midwicket
classy! Back of a length, not quick enough, and he rides the bounce to pull square

full on off, and he takes a small step forward to defend. Struck back to the bowler, who them takes aim at the batsman. Throws it to Shehzad, who gets his bat in front of his body to stop the ball from hitting him. Hasan apologies right away
caressed! Full, just wide outside off, and he leans into a front-foot cover drive
length ball, wide outside off, and he rides the bounce before hammering a cut over point! Typical Watto
yorker on off, and he gets his bat down to guide it to short third man

off his handle! Back of a length on middle, and the extra bounce gets big on Watson. Watson turns his face while trying to fend, and the ball bounces towards square leg after hitting his handle. Could've easily been out caught if a man was there
length ball on leg, and he defends with the bat's straight face
slower ball, length delivery outside off and angling away. Mistimes a drive to cover
guided to third man
full on middle, and clipped away to square leg for a single
length ball, just outside off, and he takes a tiny step forward to defend
fullish, wide outside off, and he clatters a square drive through the infield! Using the pace well

length ball, wide outside off but angling in. Tapped to mid-off for a quick single, but a swift pick-up-and-throw from there has hit the stumps at the batsman's end! Watson doesn't bother waiting, and has an argument with Imam-ul-Haq on the way back. Imam gave Watson a proper send-off after the Australian was dismissed
tapped to the leg side
full on off, and tapped to mid-off off the front foot
length ball, angling in, and worked away to the leg side
length ball, angling across and punched to cover. 147kph!
short! Back of a length on off, and he tries to pull. Can't connect, Akmal misfields too. They scamper across for a single, and Akmal's throw at the batsman's end nearly gets Ahsan out as well
full on off, and he caresses a drive past the off side. Uses the 145kph pace well, and pierces the gap between cover and cover point
length ball angling in, and going down the leg side, but Ahsan manages to get a thigh-graze off that, and it runs fine for four! Quetta won't mind
nearly a yorker just outside off. He mistimes a drive to cover
length ball on off, and angling in. Tapped off the back foot to mid-on
clipped! Full on off, and he shuffles across the stumps, before whipping this past midwicket! Fielder chaperones the ball to the boundary line
hammered! Back of a length, slower ball, and he picks it early. Stays on the back foot, and absolutely clatters a front-foot pull over cow corner for six
nearly a yorker on off, and he digs this away to the off side. They scamper across for as ingle
length ball, just outside off, and tapped off the back foot to cover
full on leg, and going down the leg side too. Kamran shuffles across to his left to intercept
pulled in front of square Length ball, not quick enough, and he pulls over cow corner for another six. Quetta need 90 off 90
length ball on the leg stump, clipped to midwicket. 142 kph
slashed and slashed hard. Short outside off, not very wide, but that's a pacy 144 kph and he cuts it hard to the third man boundary
pushed into the offside for a single
good length on off, defended to cover
bowls this too wide outside off. Short and slanting away, ends up as a wide. Kamran gets an awkward bounce and they get an extra run
bouncer on leg stump, goes just past the batsman. Not called a wide
back of a length on the stumps, squeezed to short midwicket off a thickish inside edge and they take a single
too full on the stumps, clipped off his toes to deep square leg
pulls the bouncer to the boundary short ball on middle stump but Shehzad dealt with it superbly. Stayed still, transferred weight back and pulled it all along the ground to the square leg fence
length ball on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
back of a length, coming in a touch from outside off, he stays in his crease and opens the face of the bat to steer it to third man
good length coming in a touch from off stump again, nudged to mid-off
fullish outside off, tries to drive but gets the toe-end back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, he moves across and flicks it off his hips to fine leg

top edge lands safely sharp bouncer from Wahab, too quickly onto him. He was late on the pull, it took the top edge and looped towards fine leg. Tymal Mills at the boundary was a bit late to pick it up and run in, and could only collect it one bounce
full on the pads, wristed to deep square leg

bouncer does the trick another pacy short delivery, climbing towards the throat area. He stayed in his crease and went for the pull in front of square, but gets it towards the end of the bat and the ball pops straight to short midwicket. Wahab has made the breakthrough Zalmi needed
a fiery bouncer to greet him, and he ducks under it
late movement into the batsman, that was at 148 kph! He does well to get his bat down in time to this almost yorker length delivery and dab it into the legside
looped up, a touch too full just outside off, driven to long-off
too short and slanted across him, all he had to do is lay bat on it with his cut shot and place the ball. Did both rather easily, for a boundary to backward point
fuller on the stumps, worked to deep midwicket. They run hard to get a second
tossed up on off stump, patted back to the bowler off the end of the bat
ooh a bit of a leading edge to long-on, gets some turn
good ball, on a length outside off and turning away a bit, patted to mid-off
yorker on leg stump, he does well to clip it off his toes to fine leg
good length, angled into the batsman, blocked back to the bowler
too far down leg and he'll have to rebowl that. Wide
angling into the pads again on a length, and rolls to fine leg off the pad. That was 145 kph
digs it in short, but the ball doesn't rise as much, Shehzad pulls it from his chest to deep midwicket, all along the ground. Helped the ball along rather than try to hit it too hard
quicker bouncer that time, and Rossouw swivels to pull it from shoulder height to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the offside. They wisely decide against the run
fullish ball outside off, slower one at 108 kph, driven to cover where Sammy tumbles to his right and saves
too short outside off and enough room to free his arms and slap it through cover
too full outside off, a handsome cover drive but there is a sweeper out on the offside boundary so only one run
full on the pads, clipped around the corner for another easy single
slower ball, back of a length coming into him from wide of the stumps, he waits for it and paddle-pulls it to deep square leg
another slower ball, fullish outside off, he flays it through cover but there is protection in the deep
too short and too wide outside off, Rossouw just stays in his crease and slaps it through extra cover for a four
too short once again, angling into him, he rocks back and swivels to pull it to the boundary. This is poor bowling
short ball again, tried to pull it again but got only a glove to it towards short square leg. Mills bowled it slightly slower at 128 kph
another back of a length ball angling across him, cuts it but straight to point
terrible bowling this, once again short and wide. He rises up on his toes to slap this through the off side but there is protection on the boundary so it's only a single
back of a length angling into him, punched past the bowler to long-on. They settle for one run

whoa that was some timing tries for the yorker and ends up as a low full toss, Rossouw went back and just flicked it, but with powerful wrists and great timing, sending the ball screaming to the midwicket fence
slower ball on lg, turned away for a single

inside edged for four length ball outside off, gets it to bounce a bit more than expected. Shehzad tried to punch it away from body, it takes the inside edge, misses the stumps, is too far from the keeper, and goes to the boundary
length ball outside off, pushed into the offside
fullish on off, driven off the inside half of the bat to long-on
slower ball, full length on leg stump, he waits for it and uses his wrists to turn it to deep square leg. Played with soft hands, which means they have enough time to pinch a second run
short ball, doesn't go for any shot
back of a length, tight line stump to stump. Squirted to the offside
given room outside off  with a full toss and he slashes it to third  man
back of a length on off stump and he jabs it towards point off the back foot. Quick single taken
fuller ball on the stumps, turned to deep square leg
bouncer, and he ducks under it. 147 kph. Wahab ends his spell with 1 for 19, and the PSL as the third highest wicket-taker with 17 scalps
full ball outside off, steered to third man
full on the stumps, clipped off his toes to mid-on. Easy single
good length, coming into him from outside off, tucked towards midwicket. Another quick single taken
peachy shot through cover very full outside off, and he leans into the drive. Didn't move his feet but transferred weight forward well and sends it to the boundary
punched to long on
full on off, driven to mid-on for another single. The bat twisted in his hand
full outside off, driven to mid-off. He runs quickly across and that's his fifty He's steered the innings well after that initial mishap in running out Watson
slower ball, length outside off. He wanted to leather it through midwicket but gets it off the bottom half of the bat
slower ball again, coming in from outside off. Dealt with very comfortably, he stayed on the backfoot and punched it to deep point
shot too full and outside off, enough room for Rossouw to drill it through cover. Another sweetly timed shot that showcases both power and timing.
wanted to show aggression because of the last ball, ends up bowling a bouncer down leg for a wide
almost chopped on. Back of a length on off, slower one. He tried to slash it, got an under-edge that rolls towards leg slip. they get a single
length outside off steered to short third man. He fumbles and allows a single
full on leg stump, driven to mid-on
back of a length on the stumps, cramped for space and he couldn't get the pull going. Under-edges it back to the bowler
full on the stumps, and driven crisply to mid-off. Should have been no run but another fumble and they take one
length outside off, cuts to third man's right to pick up two runs

length ball coming in from off, nudged to mid-on and another quick single. They're getting these so easily all through the innings. Jordan attempted an acrobatic run-out from mid-off but missed the stumps, diving forward to break them
full on the stumps at 145 kph, driven to mid-off from the toe-end
swipes across the line to deep midwicket
patted back to the bowler
full on the stumps, driven to deep cover
length ball on the stumps, he moves aross and whips to deep square leg

full on the stumps, driven to long-off and Quetta Gladiators have won PSL 2019. Their first time ever lifting the trophy and the entire team run onto the field, even as Rossouw pumps his fist at hitting the winning runs and Shehzad celebrates
